channel.title: Mass click on objects lag
channel.description: OK, I'm 90% sure that there is some kind of code that stops lag. Whenever I click really fast on training objects in my server, it lags. When I try to click somewhere else, my character continues to train on the object and doesn't move to where I wanted to move to. I have to wait like ages before it moves. I've tested many sources, and some of them doesn't lag, some does. The problem is... the training cases from those non-laggy servers are exactly the same as the one in my source I'm using... On my original source, I have actionTimer in those cases already, but it still lags. Can somebody please tell me how to solve this lag?

item.title: Mass click on objects lag
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

[quote="~M°ose~, post:13, topic:117147"][quote author=NexondotNet link=topic=166439.msg1548706#msg1548706 date=1182943150]
I’ll show you an example of my object void -

case 299: if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) { if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("Do you mean the if statement above ^?"); addSkillXP((100*playerLevel[1]), 1); addSkillXP((100*playerLevel[18]), 18); actionTimer = 30; setAnimation(0x320); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } } break;

[/quote]

^^ You see how it says there is an action timer = 0? change that to 5 or somthing…[/quote]

Does nothing at all when I click on the object…

Read full topic

item.title: Mass click on objects lag
item.dc:creator: @frugoo_scape frugoo scape
item.description:
@frugoo_scape wrote:

I stopped it on my server.
I log the clicks and it does not let a person click fast on a object. If they do, no worry. It will just drop their click. Same way rs does it.

item.title: Mass click on objects lag
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

its your actionTimer, fix it, make it higher so it finishes counting right after the person is done doing the emote, you can figure out how long that is, in seconds, so, yea, figure it out

Read full topic
